cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTVS GOYERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. November 1941.SECRET Copy No. 43W.M. (41)112th Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 112 (41).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Wednesday, November 12, 1941, at 5-30 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson, The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,"M.P., Lord President of the Council. Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs. ..The Right Hon. A. Greenwood, M.P., The Right Hon. Sir Kingsley Wood,Minister without Portfolio. M.P., Chancellor of the Exchequer.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The following were also present:The Right Hon. Sir Earle Page,Special Envoy from the Governmentof the Commonwealth of Australia.The Right Hon. Herbert Morrison,M.P., Secretary of State for theHome Department and Minister ofHome Security.The Right Hon. L. S. Amery, M.P.,Secretary of State for India and secretary of State for Burma.The Right Hon. A. V. Alexander,M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair; Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.Admiral of the Fleet Sir dudley pound, First Sea Lord and Chief ofNaval Staff.Air Chief MarshalPortal, Chief ofThe Right Hon. Viscount- Cranborne,Secretary of State for DominionAffairs.The Right Hon. Lord Moyne, Secre-tary of State for the Colonies.Captain the Right Hon. H. D. Mar-gesson, M.P., Secretary of State forWar.The Right Hon. Brendan Bracken,M.P., Minister of Information.General Sir John Dill, Chief of theImperial General Staff.Sir Charles F. A.the Air Staff.Secretariat. 'Sir Edward Bridges.Major-General Sir Hastings Ismay.Mr. W. D. Wilkinson.Mr. L. F. Burgis.[23146] Contents.minute no. Subject. page 1 The Far East ..... ........................ 1482 India ............ .... ........ 148Suggested release of Satyagrahi detenus.The Far East. 1. The War Cabinet met to hear a statement from(Previous Sir Earle Page on the situation in the Far East.Reference: A record of the statement and of the discussion is containedW.M. (41) 109th in the Secretary's Standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions.Conclusions,Minute 2.)---.-2. The Prime Minister referred to an exchange of telegrams,which had been brought to his notice, about a proposal, which wasunder consideration by the Government of India, for the release ofthe Satyagrahi prisoners or detenus.The War Cabinet were given a short account of the position by the Secretary of State for India and Burma.The War Cabinet-Invited the Secretary of State for India and Burma tomake it clear to the Governor-General that no commitmentshould be entered into in this matter before the WarCabinet had had an opportunity of giving full consideration to the whole question.India.Suggestedrelease ofSatyagrahidetenus.Great George Street, S.W.1,November 12, 1941.WAR CABINET 112 (41).
